official-title.#text: To amend the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 to require agencies to make considerations relating to the promotion of efficiency, competition, and capital formation before issuing or modifying certain regulations.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: is amended by adding at the end the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Section 13 of the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956

text.#text: In issuing or modifying any regulation under this section, the appropriate Federal banking agencies, the

header.#text: Consideration of Promotion of Efficiency, Competition, and Capital Formation

text.#text: shall consider whether the regulation is necessary or appropriate in the public interest;
shall consider whether the regulation will promote efficiency, competition, and capital formation;
shall consider, among other matters, the impact the regulation would have on competition;
may not adopt the regulation if it would impose a burden on competition not necessary or appropriate in furtherance of the purposes of this section; and

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: that any burden on competition imposed by the regulation is necessary or appropriate in furtherance of the purposes of this section.

text.#text: shall include in the statement of basis and purpose incorporated in the regulation adopted under this section, the reasons for the determination under

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 3913 IH: To amend the Bank Holding Company Act of 1956 to require agencies to make considerations relating to the promotion of efficiency, competition, and capital formation before issuing or modifying certain regulations.

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}rights.#text: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
